1qbYow-3H-Wp6ZBAQ94i6A.text: Not worth the price or the wait.I got the 'matcha break,' which is 7 pounds for an egg waffle with gelato and kit kats and some salted caramel syrup which in my opinion did not work well with the other toppings. It tasted ok for what it is, which is basically an overpriced gimmick (the store calls itself "the next instagram sensation" on their window.). I've had better egg waffles elsewhere.

uBtncKw4YdQl7JLH5nq42A.text: my first (and only) tasting of the bubblewrap waffle luckily (for me) happened at their berwick street market stall, a week or so before they finally opened their chinatown venue. there were only a couple of people queuing, and from order to first bite the waiting time was about seven minutes. perfectly acceptable, even though only one waffle maker was working. the other one had gone kaput, but was quickly fixed and put back in use. they didn't have any ice cream as i expected (maybe i misunderstood the pictures/marketing, maybe they were out of ice cream) so my fillings were whipped cream, banana, pecan and salted caramel sauce. all tasty (but i should have asked for more cream/sauce). the fillings in my opinion should have been layered; they just dumped the bananas and pecans on top of the cream and once they were gone it was just the cream.the waffle itself was ok, if nothing mind blowing. it tastes like waffle but much thinner - the bubbles are obviously hollow so it *looks* like you're getting a truckload of food but actually it's not very filling. it's more like a thin crepe in a funny shape. that's all the hype is about: the shape. it's cute, colourful, tasty enough, instagrammable and everything. the duo running the stall seemed a bit overwhelmed with the tiny queue + malfunctioning waffle maker, but always smiling, chatty and helpful. i'd give them a 10 for service.so imagine my surprise a few days later when they opened in chinatown and i saw queues of OVER TWO HOURS. i followed them on twitter to check the reports and as expected they were not prepared for the huge numbers of food-trend-hunters that haunt london streets in search of novelty. every day they were forced to apologize for some vital ingredient missing, and i imagine how pissed i would have been if, after queueing for 2h30, someone told me "i'm afraid we're out of matcha base/ice cream/bananas/nutella/whatever it is you waited 2h30 for"it would be better for the business and the customer if everyone waited for the hype to die down a little, but then again i understand this is not how hypes work. in a couple of months there will be another novelty in town (rainbow chips or whatever) and everyone will be flocking there, allowing the "old news" to serve a better, consistent service to their (hopefully acquired) faithful clientele - or starving it from customers untill it dies a death. i hope bubblewrap waffle navigates through the initial hickups and stick around, at least for the lovely people making it and serving it.

9kncty_eSvCo68aVfJHTuQ.text: Waiting 1 hour in line to get one. It's a made to order Asian waffle with ice cream and your choice of flavor and fruit.  It was very good and worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

z0W382vzC2C1IfAetXV6GQ.text: Waffle up your day with this unique ice cream creation. They do a waffle, roll it into a cone und fill it with all kinds of crazy stuff. Chose between ice cream scoops like vanilla, matcha or strawberry cheesecake, add toppings like fruits, nuts or sweets, add a sauce and you get an amazingly huge and individualized ice cream. Super yummy, although waiting in line for about 40 minutes takes longer than the actual eating process.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

AgpxQP5ABRDKls2wq5HZdA.text: We loved our waffles! Yes, the line was a little long but for me it was worth the wait. It's in Chinatown and the perfect photo op with your cones. We went on a Tuesday evening about 8pm. We waited in line for about 45 min. My sister and I demolished it. The waffle itself has an interesting flavor like a sugar cone but not exactly. Pics are great for IG. We went and stay at a park to the left of the Lego store to eat. They only had 2 people actually assembling or order. One guy was working 3-4 waffle irons at the same time. One young lady was on the register. That's why it takes a while. But just pack your patience. You know everything is fresh because it's made in front of you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

TiUkNMgR3Pt9gzus4kFpJQ.text: This is my last bubble waffle in Chinatown before I headed back to home to Taipei after a semester abroad in London! My friend got the original bubble flavor while I got the special matcha bubble flavor! Both of which are £4.50 each. When I got there, the queue was out of the door. Luckily, it was a fast paced queue which meant that the employees were efficient and speedy! This place was quite easy to find because the sign on the glass window is relatively huge. This is definitely worth a try if you have never had Hong Kong bubble waffles before!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

ch2HaWqqIW_9GM0s72h2YA.text: Got a chance to visit this shop recently. The smell was amazing and I really could have probably just ate there all day but alas we must limit ourselves. I had the fish shaped cone and my daughter had the bubble waffle we each tried the other and both were really good I think I preferred the fish cone myself. They only had vanilla or green tea for options on the ice cream and the Oreos were peanut butter so something to be aware of but overall very good and glad we got there

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

chGznz_nLvutu3yMCLtWCA.text: Unique concept. But ice cream and waffle don't taste as good. Could probably get much better ice cream elsewhere for less.

xPkhVV4E3ucSm3D1Pr3m3Q.text: I kept seeing people walking around the area with it.  Then I found this place.  That was one interesting waffle and ice cream dessert.  It was crafted well that went with the flavor.  This is a place not to miss if you are in London Chinatown.

pdhnz_te_hG__7Syvv2C0g.text: Had to wait for about two hours for this! You can either do a make-your-own or choose from the menu. Price goes up as you add more ingredients.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Oreo-up + strawberry

GOcS3iA6jP9WnGaze1nWAg.text: Soooo good!  It tasted as good as it looked!  The place is tiny and often has long queue.  The queue is a little awkward inside with people entering and exiting the a very narrow doorway.  No biggie though.  Great dessert after dinner.

15UAOOS4sdYL1BxEC8_Dyg.text: First time we tried this place. Very busy, line is out the door and winds. Located at the edge of Chinatown in London. Based on the line we thought it must be good. So we stood in line like everyone. Took roughly 30 minutes. Very small store. Has a big picture window where customers waiting outside in line can see the waffles being prepared. Narrow building so line goes in & wraps around. So everyone is cozy in the line. When you finally make it inside, you can smell the goodness of the waffles. So many options to choose from. There are preset waffle options on the menu or one can create their own.  We went with one on their preset menu with chocolate. Very tasty little waffle puffs. Very airy & light. Kinda makes you feel like there are no calories, wishful thinking, haha!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Voila - the creation!!
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Hard at work creating delish bubble waffles

9P7O3AeZJDZyWVtCF5KgeQ.text: Love love love love love! Ok price about 13£ for the two custom ones I ordered. The concept and delivery was amazingly cute. This is a must have if you are in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry Cheesecake gelato with waffle bubble wrap banana and white chocolate

ds8EPm1hWmBI-W6TJpLt2g.text: Last Wednesday Bubblewrap Waffle finally opened its doors. The owners were selling their egg waffles on Saturdays at a pop-up stall before and you can tell they know what they're doing! Unfortunately, everyone wants a piece of these egg waffles which leads to a queue time of up to three hours. The quality and taste of the waffles was perfect. The outside was very crisp, while the inside was nice and chewy/ soft. They only had the normal base flavour but they'll offer chocolate and matcha flavoured waffle bases soon. The variety they offer for toppings and ice cream flavours is amazing. I chose strawberries, raspberries, Oreos and Nutella as toppings and the combo didn't disappoint. They were very generous with them and also added some powdered sugar on top. The waffles are a bit challenging to eat because of the massive amount of toppings inside the waffle but nothing a napkin can't fix. Even though we had to wait for so long, it was really worth the wait and all three of us really enjoyed our waffles! The staff is also very friendly and helpful when it comes to ordering and explaining/ suggesting ongoing promotions. If it wasn't for the long queue time I'd definitely give Bubblewrap Waffle five stars! I'll come back to try more of their flavours (and the chocolate and matcha base). Hopefully the waiting times will have reduced in a few weeks and it'll be easier to drop by for dessert.Important to know: they only accept card payments!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. three different waffles from their favourites selection
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. A normal base with strawberries, raspberries, Oreos and Nutella
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. A selection of the toppings available

ba7iGwm98KxNBlIYC_pOzg.text: What's not to love. Got there fairly early and queue was  small. (Can get pretty long). Absolutely delicious. Blew my diet for it big time!

vPZy7XVCqrtGXur0A1gKEQ.text: Was very delicious, would highly recommend it. If you're in London or specifically China town go grab yourself some ice cream and a Bubblewrap Waffle

10mrZPl73tJl_Vgh86ycuQ.text: A little bit pricy, but is okay, still wanna try. So pretty, i wish they can give two scoops of ice cream instead of one. Love it, love it, hope they have something similar in USA.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

No3cCu_V1OSC4PHXiVZSGw.text: Waited in line for this delectable goody between parts of the cursed child. Well worth the wait and satisfying enough to skip dinner! The employees here were kind and took their time and attention with my order. As the assembler handed my waffle to me with care she warned, be careful! This was so beautiful thy a stranger asked if she could photograph it! And it was delicious. The waffle was light and airy, not crunchy. Ate the dessert in its entirety. I went with my own creation: hazelnut ice cream, which was creamy and not at all too nutty; Oreos, white chocolate, syrup, condensed milk, and whipped cream. A little pricey but I splurged (£8.50). Everything about it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bubble waffle cone
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bubble wrap create your own
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Hazelnut icecream, oreos, white chocolate, whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and condensed milk.  lightly dusted with powdered sugar

WKM3-Ht-sggnAmbrJArAgQ.text: Overall, it tasted okay. I thought it was over priced especially for the toppings. I paid 8.49 total. Yes it is pretty, but was it worth 8.49? no. 1 strawberry thinly sliced into 6 pieces (additional 0.50), 3 half cut raspberries=1.5 raspberries (additional 0.50) , 4 pieces of mochi (additional 0.50), whip cream (0.50) and condensed milk drizzle (0.50). I expected a bit more toppings. I'm glad I got to try it, but I probably won't get it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. 3 half cut raspberries (1.5 raspberry), 4 pieces of Mochi, 1 strawberry sliced into 6 pieces. Way too little toppings for $
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Overpriced

s6gibEpEN3L5FwX2HMq3uw.text: After a nice stroll down Westminster and into Leicester Square, we walked into Chinatown and were alarmed by a group of people standing in line to go into a store.. We randomly decided to get in line and see what the commotion was about. Turns out it was the grand opening of Bubblewrap!So we waited for a bit [which wasn't that bad as we were trying to figure out what Bubblewrap was and after that, had to get our minds straight on what we wanted in our waffles..]So Bubblewrap is a waffle place that makes waffles that look like ..bubblewrap. First you choose your waffle flavor (plain, chocolate, or matcha), then it's made to order and the waffle is formed into a cone. Then it's stuffed with all sorts of things: ice cream, fruits, chocolate/caramel sauces, chocolate bars, mochi, and even red beans if that's what you fancy. Finally, you either attack it like you would an ice cream cone or pop off the bubbles and dip them into the toppings before popping it in your mouth. Either way, very delicious! Refreshing and oh so enjoyable. My favorite is the one with strawberry cheesecake ice cream and Oreo bits with salted caramel sauce, but I'm very excited to try all the variations -while trying to mind my waistline. My friend got one with vanilla ice cream with strawberries and Nutella on top and loved hers as well. Initially we thought of getting one waffle to share as it seemed like it would be a meal, but we got one each and somehow got through all of it comfortably and it wasn't killing us by the end of it as the waffle is super airy and light. Also, props to them for the sturdy and tightly sealed cardboard waffle receptacle.. It made eating the waffle more convenient and kept the sauces and melting ice cream at bay. It didn't leak at all, making your waffle eating on-the-go experience just that much better. Overall very delightful!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Strawberry cheesecake ice cream with Oreo pieces and salted caramel sauce: ALL the flavors which ALL blend beautifully.
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Left to right: vanilla ice cream with strawberries and Nutella, strawberry cheesecake ice cream with Oreos and salted caramel sauce.

BiiUJ63xOTwFTsniTgHHmw.text: So delicious! Small spot in Chinatown with a queue out the door. The warm and not too sweet waffle cone is delicious! The dark chocolate gelato rivals any that I have had in Italy. My only complaint is the high price! What a treat though.

yaEK2VzOBPmwaXu3b_whtQ.text: Was so delicious!! Definitely recommend giving it a try! It's usually a pretty long line, I had to wait about 15 minutes which was pretty short in comparison to the 1 1/2 wait the night before. I got the berry good (strawberries, whipped cream, and Nutella drizzle) but I added the pistachio gelato. The waffle cone was warm and soft which paired nicely with the ice cream. I savored every bite. It is a bit pricey, but you get a lot. It's best to share with someone. It's fun watching it all being prepared.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Finishing touches

aUc13wAOQo4H07qIxN1AZg.text: I found this hidden gem when I was in Los Angeles. I had bookmarked it in hopes of one day coming and I did! Although it's a small little shop they can really get down to business. They make these delicious and fluffy bubble wrap waffles right in front of you. They are so fresh and soft that they melt in your mouth. There was no wait whatsoever. I will never forget this place and hopefully I'll be back again one day! (Until then please make a shop in LA! )

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

ABKpCZcfgk_vNgmWIxISHw.text: We were wandering around in Chinatown and walked by Bubblewrap and wanted to try it. We were here about a year and a half ago and there was a massive line out the door and down the street. We didnt want to wait then, but found it to be much more reasonable on this visit. I've seen these type of waffle cones get popular on Instagram and figured I was really missing out on something amazing. In actuality, you are essentially eating ice cream out of a waffle...I don't know what else I was expecting, but it is what it is. Dont get me wrong, all the ingredients were great, especially the gelato! The waffle was warm and soft and made a nice edible container, but I wasn't as blown away as I was expecting to be. Let's just say I enjoyed my dessert, but I am also glad I didnt wait an hour in line to get it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bubble Waffle
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Exterior

CFNO9CPgjmCDCmHDF3i3jQ.text: Was able to try bubblewrap for the first time and it was great!I have seen lines that extend all the way to the hotel and I would probably end up giving this review a lower rating if I had to wait in that.  I got the Oreo Up and it was decent, I didn't get to choose the most extravagant off the menu.  This was a nice quick eat and was happy about the outcome.Not sure I would wait an hour for this, but 10-15 minutes is a maybe.

MXP-wzI4_DxGIqpBAQsl8Q.text: Finally I got a chance to try the bubblewaffle!The queue was not too big so I took my turn to try it! We waited 15 minutes to be served which is not too bad.I built my own waffle: lemon base waffle, pistachio sorbet, raspberry and hazelnuts.It was good and tasty and lighter that I thought!The only bad point is : it's very FRAGILE! I wanted to eat some waffle with the sorbet but almost all the waffle collapsed!!!I didn't lose any part (maybe 1 raspberry ?) so it was fine

pbdAYL_OnnWi-Y8ExwkB7g.text: Just chanced upon this place after going for lunch at a restaurant opposite. I had the plain bubble waffle with vanilla ice cream and crushed oreos (they usually put them whole, but I requested them to crush them). It was a classic, but good. My brother went for the plain with hazelnut icecream with nutella and chocolate sauce, and he said his was nice too. Got really messy while eating it! The place is way too overpriced though, and you end up paying quite a lot even if you add just a couple toppings. Not sure its worth it. Its also quite small and there's like no place to sit inside and and wait for your order. You keep rubbing against other customers. Not the best experience. This also means you have to go outside, stand and have your treats.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Plain bubble waffle with vanilla ice cream and crushed oreos.

bNgHUo0UiD8aqJbt2I85mg.text: This is obviously a tourist trap, but who doesn't love bubblewrap? It was adorable, and I have no shame. Eat it if you like ice cream, mochi, red bean, and all things kawaii.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

Q_jfY2vuCMTFTswtMTYptg.text: It was a little bit of a wait but well worth it. The workers make the waffles right in front of you. I really appreciate how the workers put so much detailing into their waffles. There are quite a few flavors to choose from. I chose the matcha option. It tasted very refreshing and not too heavy, like how ice cream can be sometimes. If you come to London, this is a must when you're in their China Town!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Matcha with sweet red beans. Delicious and refreshing!

H6S-MQ9uSsg6G23jfduA9g.text: The dessert is tasty, but not tasty enough to wait 40 minutes for.They really need to rework the store and training to have greater efficiency, because it was averaging around 1-2 minutes per dessert (based on what was coming out of the door), so the 30-40 people in front of us literally meant we waited 40 minutes from the time we entered the line until the time we were walking out.Beyond the long time in line, the wait itself is not very comfortable inside. The line weaves in to the back, where you pay, and then loops itself back out as they build the ice cream and toppings, this means that people are two across in a space that's less than a meter wide, where it's also a little hot and dark.They would do better to reconfigure the store in a stand or counter format along the front so that they have more room to make the desserts (thus more people and less time for each), and more comfortable for the customers.Now the dessert itself is delicious. But waiting 40 minutes and paying £6-7? Not exactly worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Inside

eoNVa_Xzw-icvfLVEsr0Tg.text: The ice cream is so creamy and delicious and the bubble waffle is so perfect to absorb the ice cream. We got the chocolate ice cream with salted caramel sauce which was a lovely combination. After a good size dinner I just got one cone and split it with another person and it was more then enough to give us both a good taste!

5yO6jbKHh67Qf2EiGRCVVg.text: Fresh made waffles in front of your eyes while you wait in line! First bite is nice and crunchy. We had it with the matcha scoop topped with mochi and bananas. I was very happy with everything and the service is super friendly, but the prices are a bit steep, probably because it is in a touristy area. This is a take away sort of deal, but your bubblewrap will be served in a convenient to go cup. We had dinner beforehand, so sharing one between the two of us was good enough. If you have never had one, then what better place to experience your first than in Chinatown?!

vJ0CI8vEU7wJ6atMlRkwMw.text: I was so excited to try these waffles and was definitely not disappointed!The wait was about 20 minutes at 7pm on a Wednesday night. You get to choose your ice cream flavor and toppings, or you could do one of their specialty waffles.I got pistachio ice cream with strawberries, kit kats, caramel drizzle, and Nutella drizzle.It was absolutely amazing! If you're in Chinatown, you have to try this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bubble waffle
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Storefront

Io2AMagOCeFeGOQ4ZM5skA.text: I understand that Yelp isn't as popular in London since Yelp trimmed down its operations globally. The fact that there are only 6 Yelp reviews is still surprising, because if you follow new places in London, this place is plastered everywhere. Like, two-hour-wait-plastered-everywhere.Egg waffles are popular where I live, so I wondered what was different about theirs. I had to find out! We stand in line. And as many Brits will tell you, they are the master of the queue. To the point that when other people are walking by us, they too felt like they needed to queue up. Impressive.After an hour wait, we're inside. They're out of the limited waffle flavor (chocolate) and the matcha. I ordered the #4, whose matcha waffle is now a plain one. It's served with a scoop of matcha ice cream, drizzled with salted caramel, and topped with a generous amount of Kit Kats. It's almost too pretty to eat. I take a bite and note that they're the same as home -- good, but not worth a 1-hour wait.I'll say this: the savory one looked appetizing. A whole egg is cracked into the middle of the waffle batter while it cooks and is served with fresh avocado.£6.99 seems about right. (There were a lot of Kit Kats on it.) Bubblewrap could use Nowait (restaurant app) where you can place yourself in the queue, and get texted when you're turn is up next!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. #4 with matcha ice cream, salted caramel, and Kit Kats

JW_EHt8x6AGreNKsFTHF3Q.text: After waiting for nearly an hour, we finally were able to try the infamous bubblewrap waffle, and were immediately disappointed. The options for topping are great, the gelato itself is alright, and the waffle is good, but it's really not that "WOW THIS IS AMAZING" that so many people seemed to rave about. Perhaps if I had not waited so long I would not have been let down, but it just isn't anything to be raved about.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

bkaOD-FeRI357yaGKxPyNA.text: Yes! Finally! I can get my waffles without the annoying divots! Haha! Love these waffles. You can get just about any combination of treats with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

UKNytGGUTGmpNcIlYEh5Eg.text: I've had Hong Kong bubble waffle before. I've had gelato before. But never have I thought of eating them together. So well done Bubblewrap Waffle! This is an awesome combination you defo don't wanna miss out. Check the inside menu to see what are the seasonal options - now they have matcha base and raisin base. But be prepared to wait longer time for special bases. I chose the original base with matcha green tea gelato and hazelnut topping. Both the base and the gelato were great. But the waffle was too crispy that it could easily collapse :-(

9VnvcvVaiqYfaNBGAOIeFA.text: My rating is more of a 3.5 than a 4. I stopped by with a friend on a beautiful Sunday afternoon around 1 PM; it was basically the perfect weather for ice cream that day. I was surprised the queue actually didn't look as long as I'd expected given it was a nice weekend. We waited around 40 minutes, but it passed by quickly since we could keep each other company and were also trying to figure out what to order. The smell of the waffles is also really enticing while you wait, and you can see some of the staff at work making waffles through the window.I chose the build-your-own, with gelato and 4 toppings, which came out to be about £8. My friend got the House Matcha with no alterations. I really enjoyed mine, but my friend thought his was a bit bland. It was pretty easy to order; you tell the cashier what you want and pay, and then pick up your order when they call it out. Since it's such a small space, it's a bit awkward leaving when you've got your cone, so take care not to spill any of your toppings as you squeeze through. There's not really space to eat inside, but it's mostly a takeaway place anyway.The staff were polite and worked probably as efficiently as they could given the number of waffle makers and all the toppings/decorating involved. The menu showed multiple waffle flavors but all of them were crossed out except the original; probably they couldn't be bothered having to deal with multiple waffle mixes when the queues got long. The menus also made it clear which menu items didn't have cream or gelato in; probably this wasn't clear in the past and they got customer complaints, so they had some pretty conspicuous writing on the menu board to make it clearer.I was really pleased I got to try this out, as I've got a massive sweet tooth and it was fun to eat. However, at £7-8 a cone and with a 40+ min wait on even a good day, it's probably not something I'd do again, now that the novelty has worn off. Maybe I'll come back if they ever bring back the matcha flavored waffles.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. View of window
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Bubblewrap waffle with vanilla gelato, mochi, strawberries, and salted caramel sauce

RZSN3z_tYE9AqmclX30_4g.text: My friend Seneca visited London a few weeks before my visit and absolutely RAVED about this place, so naturally it was one of my first stops! I got there about 15 minutes before it opened, and there was already a queue of about 10 people. Luckily the employees are efficient and the line moved quickly. They also passed along menus while you were waiting, so you could decide while in line. I got the original bubblewrap (there was also cocoa and matcha) with matcha ice cream, nutella (naturally) and strawberries. It was absolutely delicious and lived up to the hype. It's also housed in this genius paper cone - there are little perforations along the cone so you can tear off strips as you eat and still avoid getting your hands sticky. I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom

_pn3EOoDjictYkwJkDeADA.text: For me it was just ok. They have original waffle and then other waffle flavors to choose from. The time i went was a cocoa based waffle. I opted to try their strawberry cheesecake with mochi and condensed milk drizzle. It tasted fine but There was nothing mind blowing about it, but i guess with everything nowadays, it was instagram worthy, otherwise, it didn't happen right ;) I've read that the line can take long, sometimes waiting up to 30-45 minutes to put an order in. It was just me in the store and it took 10 minutes for my order. I cant imagine waiting in line for that long though.

desgj9ow8F4rq5wlOt23lQ.text: A fun yummy dessert place in China town! We passed by it the first time since it's fairly nondescript, except for the small line outside and the lovely smell of waffles. My husband got the peanut butter and I made my own with original waffle cone, matcha gelato, strawberry, whipped cream, and chocolate sauce.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Peanut butter and create your own: original cone, matcha gelato, toppings: , cream, and chocolate sauce!
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Create your own options
Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom. Breaking down the dessert

wG50EPBL8KXkjgQGeTKTSA.text: You have to visit here at least once if you're in London! If not for the yummy waffles and ice cream, then at least for the picture. The waffles were soft and warm, and depending on the special of the day, you may be able to get matcha flavored waffles. I also topped mine with a scoop of matcha ice cream, hazelnut ice cream, mochi, and condensed milk. It was delicious and massive. However, there is a long wait for it - about an hour on a weekday afternoon, and they messed up my order so I had to wait even longer.

photos.caption: Photo of Bubblewrap Waffle - London, United Kingdom
